DataElement.preferredName: Immunization Vaccine Dose Unit of Measure PCORnet CDM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._The unit of measure that is associated with the dose of a substance administered to the subject.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._The unit of measure that is associated with the dose of a substance administered to the subject._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immunization Vaccine Dose Unit of Measure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.:Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response._The unit of measure that is associated with the dose of a substance administered to the subject.
